ratings.comment: Very small class.  Trone was great and connected with her students. She graded fairly easily.  4 short essays. 1 research paper. In-class ID/essay midterm.  Out of class final. Participation was a large grade and focused on online forums.  A good amount of reading is required.  Overall, she made a broad subject very interesting and entertaining.

one of the worst professors I had. Isn't clear when giving assignments and is not up to date on grading so you never know where you stand in the class. She is very difficult to contact outside of class. Lectures are all over the place. I would not recommend taking a class with this professor.
Very good professor, helpful, and fair tests. Knows her stuff, and a consistent grader. Lectures are somewhat dry but have all of the information. Very good class!

Needs to learn to relax when lecturing. Tries to be all gruff and dry to cover up her nervousness and it's annoying. But the lectures themselves aren't that bad. She definitely knows her stuff and cares about it. Do be warned: this is not an easy class.

One of the most genuinely dedicated teachers I've ever had. Goes out of her way to make lecture interesting and engaging. Extremely knowledgable, encourages class discussion, not too difficult, before this class i hated studying history but PRof Trone made is so enjoyable i actually liked class, one of the most approachable teachers ive had at UW
